API¶

This part of the documentation covers the application interface. For functional dependencies on external libraries, links to relevant documentation is provided.

The App Factory¶

alignment.create_app(test_config=None)¶

Creates and configures an instance of the Flask application.

To load a development or production configuration, leave out the optional dictionary parameter. Only use this to override the default configs for something like testing.

Parameters

test_config (dict or None) – An optional dictionary of configuration mappings

Returns

a Flask() instance

The Frontend¶

View Function¶

alignment.frontend.index()¶

Processes user requests and renders templates to defined endpoints.

This is the workhorse of application. See the Flask Documentation on views to read more.

Returns

A Flask render_template() function

The Forms¶

class alignment.forms.AlignForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

Initial alignment form that is rendered when the user first logs in.

An instance of a WTForm that takes a pair of gene names and data.

Variables

  • gene1_name – A WTForm StringField

  • gene1_content – A WTForm StringField

  • gene2_name – A WTForm StringField

  • gene2_content – A WTForm StringField

  • align_button – A WTForm SubmitField

class alignment.forms.AnotherForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

Secondary form that will only add a single gene to the existing stack.

Rendered only after the initial form is submitted to avoid confusion and indicate that additional genes can be aligned.

Variables

  • gene_name – A WTForm StringField

  • gene_content – A WTForm StringField

  • another_button – A WTForm SubmitField

  • wipe_button – A WTForm SubmitField

class alignment.forms.SettingsForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

Form to change output settings (file output type or line wrap number).

Variables

  • output_type – A WTForm SelectField

  • wrap_number – A WTForm IntegerField

  • apply_button – A WTForm SubmitField

Alignment Functionality¶

alignment.clustalo_align.run_clustalo(temp_path, output_type, wrap_number)¶

Runs a clustalo command in a subprocess and captures the output.

This function takes a fasta (.fa) file containing genomic information and performs an alignment on the data using the output_type and wrap_number parameters. The output of the process, whether it is functional alignment data or any error printed to the stderr, will be returned.

Parameters

temp_path – The file path with the .fa file containing the genomic

information to align. :type temp_path: str :param output_type: A key in the OUTUPUT_DICT dictionary that corresponds to a clustalo output type. :type output_type: str :param wrap_number: A number that specifies how long each output line should be. Must be positive, nonzero. :type wrap_number: int :return: Binary data from the result of the process, either from the stdout or stderr

alignment.clustalo_align.capture_alignment(session, gene_dict)¶

Takes a dictionary of gene data and captures the alignment.

The dictionary should have the following format:

{'gene1': 'ATTT', 
 'gene2':'CCC'}

It’s contents will be converted to fasta files and passed to a Clustalo binary through a subprocess. The stdout (or stderr) is collected and returned as binary data.

The passed session object provides the command line options for the clustalo executable.

Parameters

  • session – A Flask session object

  • gene_dict (int) – A dictionary mapping gene names to data

Returns

Binary alignment output data

Database API¶

alignment.db.get_db()¶

Creates a connection with the SQLite database.

If a connection already exists in the current request (accessed through the Flask g object), the existing connection will be returned.

Returns

an sqlite3 Connection object that can represent the database.

alignment.db.close_db(e=None)¶

Closes a connection with the SQLite database.

This function is called implicitly by app.teardown_appcontext when a request has finished. There is therefore no need to explicitly call it.

alignment.db.insert_genes(session, g)¶

Inserts gene data from the current app context into the SQLite database.

Gene data is extracted from the gene_dict attribute of the g object A UUID is extracted from the Flask session object, that persists across all requests.

Parameters

  • session – Flask session object

  • g – Flask g object

alignment.db.query_genes(session)¶

Querys all genes associated with a unique user.

The UUID is stored and extracted from the Flask Session object.

Parameters

session – Flask session object

Returns

A list of of sqlite3 Row objects, which have intuitive

tuple-esque behavior. Docs for sqlite3 Rows’

alignment.db.wipe_genes(session)¶

Deletes all genes associated with a unique UUID from the session.

Parameters

session – Flask session object

alignment.db.wipe_all_genes()¶

Deletes all gene data from the database (ignores UUID identifier).

alignment.db.get_gene_dict(session)¶

Returns a dictionary of queried genes based on the session’s unique UUID.

Parameters

session – Flask session object

Returns

dict

alignment.db.init_db()¶

Initializes database as defined in the schema.sql file.

The schema.sql file is located in the alignment package’s root directory.

This command is wrapped with the click package. It should be used from the command line when configuring a new app.

alignment.db.init_db_command(*args, **kwargs)¶

Wraps the init_db() function as a click command command.

alignment.db.init_app(app)¶

Registers Flask app instance with ‘init-db’ command and adds close_db() to the app.teardown_appcontext() stack.

Parameters

app – a Flask instance

This should never be referenced directly by the user. The app is registered in the __init__ module.
